The module, linked to Jaish, planned Hamas-style drone attacks and was building small rockets for serial blasts. Wani allegedly provided technical support for these drone modifications and rocket construction, aiming to replicate attacks seen in conflict zones.

India responded cautiously, acknowledging the verdict and reiterating its commitment to Bangladesh's peace and stability, while remaining non-committal on extradition requests.

title: Hasina death verdict: Son calls ruling 'a joke and meaningless'; political storm grows
description: Former Bangladesh PM Sheikh Hasina has been sentenced to death in absentia by a tribunal for "crimes against humanity" over her government's crackdown on a mass uprising. The tribunal accused her of murder, torture, and ordering the use of lethal weapons. Hasina, who fled to India, called the tribunal "rigged" and "politically motivated."

description: India's state-run oil companies have secured a one-year deal to import 2.2 million tonnes of cooking gas from the US, marking a significant diversification of its energy sources. This move is expected to help balance trade, a key concern for the US administration, and reduce reliance on traditional Gulf suppliers.

description: Home Minister Amit Shah vowed to bring perpetrators of the Delhi car bomb blast to justice, emphasizing the government's commitment to eradicating terrorism. Addressing the Northern Zonal Council meeting, he highlighted the importance of inter-state cooperation for national strength and discussed speedy justice for crimes against women and children, including increasing fast-track courts.

description: Mr. Trump has intensified his campaign against maritime drug trafficking, authorising more forceful interdiction operations and giving U.S. forces expanded authority to disable or sink vessels suspected of carrying narcotics

description: An emotional Tejashwi Prasad Yadav offered to step down as RJD legislative party leader, but was urged by patriarch Lalu Prasad to continue. The party's poor election performance was discussed, with leaders blaming EVMs and demanding a return to ballot papers for future elections.

title: Assam roll update: EC orders special revision; opts out of SIR amid NRC concerns
description: The Election Commission has ordered a special revision of Assam's electoral roll for the upcoming assembly polls, with January 1, 2026, as the qualifying date. This mandatory house-to-house verification aims to include all eligible citizens without requiring proof of eligibility. Details of 'doubtful' voters will be carried forward pending tribunal orders.

title: A hundred years ago | Bombay mills crisis
Missing for 28 years: SIR scare brings man home; family stunned by reappearance
description: A man missing for 28 years, Jagabandhu Mondal, returned to his village in West Bengal to reclaim his voter identity. Believed dead by his family, he reappeared after losing his job, only to find his name deleted from electoral rolls. His return presents a challenge for authorities to verify his identity and restore his voting status.

title: Maharashtra civic polls: SC warns on breaching 50% quota cap; threatens to stall nominations
description: The Supreme Court has mandated that total reservations for SC, ST, and OBCs in Maharashtra civic body elections must not exceed 50%. The court warned it would halt the nomination process in constituencies breaching this limit. Elections will proceed based on pre-July 2010 OBC reservation norms, as the Banthia Commission's report is not yet finalized.

title: West Bengal school recruitment scam: ‘Tainted’ candidates have made it to the fresh interview list, allege teachers
description: Fresh protests erupted in Kolkata ahead of the interview as many ‘untainted’ teachers who lost their jobs after the Supreme Court order cry foul

title: HC delay order slammed: SC raps MP court; flags breach of judicial discipline
description: The Supreme Court has expressed strong disapproval of High Courts disregarding its rulings and judicial precedent. Justices J B Pardiwala and K V Viswanathan questioned how the Madhya Pradesh High Court could condone a nearly five-year delay by the state government in filing an appeal, emphasizing the need for judicial discipline and adherence to established legal principles.

title: Kylian Mbappe now claims Paris Saint-Germain owe him 260 million euros; PSG demand 440 million euros from striker

description: The Supreme Court expressed concern over states permitting liquor sales in small tetra packs, likening them to juice containers and highlighting potential risks to children. This issue emerged during a trademark dispute between whisky producers Allied Blenders and John Distillers, where tetra packs constitute a significant portion of sales in some regions.

title: Is LaMelo Ball playing vs Raptors tonight? Latest update on Hornets star

After an ankle injury sidelined him, Ball's return is crucial for the depleted Hornets. His playmaking and leadership are expected to elevate the team's performance and pace, aiming to boost their standing in the Eastern Conference.

description: “India has noted the verdict announced by the Tribunal concerning former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. As a close neighbour, India remains committed to the best interests of the people of Bangladesh,” the Ministry of External Affairs says

title: France-Ukraine arms deal: Paris to supply 100 Rafale jets to Kyiv - what it means
description: France and Ukraine have signed a significant defense pact, potentially including up to 100 Rafale fighter jets, drones, and advanced air defense systems over a decade. President Macron emphasized long-term support, while President Zelenskyy hailed the agreement as historic amidst ongoing Russian advances and domestic reforms. Deliveries are planned post-conflict, underscoring the need for a strong Ukrainian army.

description: Indian exports to the US saw a monthly uptick in October, a positive sign despite hefty tariffs. However, year-on-year figures reveal a notable decline compared to last October. Overall, India's aggregate exports faced a significant dip, with only a few key markets showing growth, while imports surged due to precious metal purchases.

description: A Bengaluru woman lost nearly Rs 32 crore in a sophisticated "digital arrest" scam. Posing as CBI officers, fraudsters subjected her to constant Skype surveillance, threatening immediate arrest. Over six months, she made 187 bank transfers, believing she was proving her innocence, before receiving a fake clearance letter.

description: Jeff Bezos is back in a formal leadership role. He is co-chief executive of a new AI startup called Project Prometheus. The company has secured a massive $6.2 billion in funding. Project Prometheus aims to revolutionize manufacturing and engineering. It will focus on AI for sectors like aerospace and automotive. Top talent from OpenAI, DeepMind, and Meta have joined the startup. This venture marks Bezos's first operational role since leaving Amazon.

The article revisits five memorable series, highlighting iconic moments like Ben Stokes' Headingley heroics in 2019 and England's narrow 2005 victory.

Nvidia export loophole: Chinese firm taps Jakarta pipeline; Blackwell chips bypass curbs
description: Despite US export bans, Chinese AI firms are acquiring Nvidia's advanced chips through complex international routes. A recent deal saw thousands of Blackwell chips reach Jakarta, destined for a Chinese company, via a US subsidiary and an Indonesian telecom provider. This workaround highlights significant gaps in US technology control strategy, alarming national security officials who fear military applications. Nvidia's CEO has voiced concerns about the economic impact of these restrictions on American businesses.

title: Delhi car blast: 'Madam Surgeon' emerges as key player; diaries hint at 'D-6 Mission'
description: Investigators are unraveling a sophisticated Jaish-e-Mohammed plot, allegedly masterminded by Dr. Shaheen Shahid, dubbed "Madam Surgeon." The module, involving Kashmiri doctors, planned coordinated strikes and a December 6th attack to "avenge" the Babri Masjid demolition. Financial trails and overseas meetings with ISI handlers are under scrutiny.

title: How to send WhatsApp messages without saving a contact on your phone
description: WhatsApp allows users to initiate chats without saving contacts by using Click to Chat links or the official "Chat on WhatsApp" button. This feature streamlines communication for temporary interactions and business inquiries, offering flexibility on both mobile and web platforms. Users can create custom links with pre-filled messages for added convenience.
